channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Joyful Day of the Dead commemorations rally US Latino communities despite immigration raid fears
item.description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — More than 100 people followed Aztec dancers through an arch of paper flowers into El Colegio High School on Saturday morning to visit altars that students had created to commemorate Día de Muertos or Day of the Dead.
item.dc:creator: GIOVANNA DELL’ORTO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Michigan lawyer says the Halloween terror plot that FBI Director Kash Patel described never existed
item.description: A Michigan defense lawyer is disputing FBI allegations that his 20-year-old client and four others planned a terror attack on Halloween weekend.
item.dc:creator: Josh Funk, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza by Hamas are not of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum, three days after they were arrested by police as part of the sweeping investigation.
item.dc:creator: SYLVIE CORBET, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: With bombs and bravado, Trump puts his own stamp on Reagan's 'peace through strength' mantle
item.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — It wasn’t so long ago that President Donald Trump spoke of building a legacy as a “peacemaker.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, BEN FINLEY and MATTHEW LEE, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Carbon capture pipelines have struggled to advance. A project in Nebraska found success
item.description: A large-scale carbon capture pipeline began operating in the Midwest in September, succeeding where others have so far fallen short.
item.dc:creator: Jack Dura, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: New multistate lottery game expected in 2026 could make you a millionaire
item.description: Sure, winning a record-breaking Powerball jackpot may be cool, but what about $1 million a year for the rest of your life?
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KREX 5

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KREX 5

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KRON4

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Wisconsin becomes the 36th state to limit cellphones in schools
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin became the 36th state to limit cellphones and other electronic devices in school Friday, when its Democratic governor signed a bill requiring districts to prohibit phone use during class time.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump says he’s not considering strikes within Venezuela
item.description: President Trump on Friday said he was not considering strikes within Venezuela following reports his administration had identified potential military targets within the country.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: US Marine arrested, accused of traveling 'to meet, kidnap and sexually assault' 12-year-old girl: FBI
item.description: Active-duty Marine William Richard Roy arrested by FBI for allegedly traveling from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and assault a 12-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to pay SNAP benefits with emergency funds
item.description: U.S. District Judge John McConnell’s order prevents the administration from completely drying up the benefit for more than 40 million Americans.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, NewsNation

item.title: California man accused of raping woman who was seeking immigration help
item.description: “The suspect offered the victim $400 and a discount on her case if she did not contact police,” authorities added.
item.dc:creator: Josh DuBose, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Jury convicts California activist who took chickens from Perdue Farms plant
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — A California animal rights activist who took four chickens from a major Perdue Farms poultry plant was found guilty Wednesday of felony conspiracy, trespassing and other charges and faces several years in jail.
item.dc:creator: OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Judge's order blocking removal of man from US wasn't received until after he was deported, DHS says
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration authorities did not receive word of a court order blocking the removal of a man living in Alabama until after he had been deported to Laos, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday, dismissing claims that officials violated the order.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: What shutdown? Trump isn't canceling travel, golf or his ballroom even with the government shuttered
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump isn't curtailing travel. He's not avoiding golf or making do with a skeleton staff in the West Wing. Even hamburgers served at the White House aren't from McDonalds, this time.
item.dc:creator: WILL WEISSERT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: A sheriff says a North Carolina suspect may have killed 4 of his children over several months
item.description: SMITHFIELD, N.C. (AP) — The North Carolina man accused of killing four of his children after human remains were found inside the trunk of a vehicle at their home appears to have spread the slayings over several months, a sheriff said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Russian mobsters sentenced to 25 years for foiled plot to assassinate Iranian dissident journalist
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two purported Russian mobsters were each sentenced to 25 years behind bars Wednesday for hiring a hitman to kill Iranian American journalist Masih Alinejad at her Brooklyn home three years ago on behalf of the Iranian government.
item.dc:creator: LARRY NEUMEISTER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Taco kits recalled in 27 states over 'life-threatening' seasoning mix-up: FDA
item.description: The taco seasoning packets didn't contain taco seasoning, according to the company that produced the kits.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Langenfeld, Fox 5

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Months after a man was killed at a 'No Kings' march, no one has been charged. His wife wants answers
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) — The widow of a beloved Utah fashion designer who was fatally shot during a June “No Kings” protest in Salt Lake City demanded Wednesday that someone be held accountable for her husband's death after more than four months without any charges filed in the case.
item.dc:creator: HANNAH SCHOENBAUM and MATTHEW BROWN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cuomo hasn't condemned bigoted attacks on Mamdani. In 1977 race, his father took another approach
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — In 1977, at the tail end of another bruising battle for New York City mayor, Mario Cuomo publicly spoke up against bigoted remarks leveled at his opponent. Almost 50 years later, his son is taking a different approach.
item.dc:creator: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Wall Street Journal urges GOP to kill ObamaCare subsidies
item.description: The editorial board of The Wall Street Journal is urging Republicans in Congress to end health care subsidies introduced as part of ObamaCare as the party tries to negotiate an end to the government shutdown, which has stretched into its fourth week.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Mastrangelo, Fox 5

item.title: House Republican introduces bill to fund WIC during shutdown
item.description: Rep. Rob Bresnahan (R-Pa.) on Tuesday introduced a bill to fund the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) during the government shutdown, as the funding lapse threatens payments of benefits if it continues.
item.dc:creator: Emily Brooks, WGN 9
